modules.title: Introduction to Data Structures
topics: Concepts of data, information, and data structures
Classification of data structures: linear and non-linear
Arrays and their representation in memory
Complexity analysis and asymptotic notations (Big O, Omega, Theta)

modules.title: Linked Lists
topics: Singly, doubly and circular linked lists
Dynamic memory allocation and pointers
Insertion, deletion and traversal operations
Applications of linked lists in real-world problems

modules.title: Stacks and Queues
topics: Stack operations and implementation using arrays and linked lists
Applications of stacks: recursion, expression evaluation, parentheses matching
Queue operations, circular queues and priority queues
Deque and applications of queues

modules.title: Trees
topics: Introduction to trees and basic terminologies
Binary trees, traversal techniques (inorder, preorder, postorder)
Binary search trees, AVL trees and heap structures
Applications of trees in searching and sorting

modules.title: Graphs
topics: Graph representation: adjacency matrix and adjacency list
Graph traversal algorithms: BFS and DFS
Minimum spanning tree algorithms (Prim’s and Kruskal’s)
Shortest path algorithms: Dijkstra’s and Floyd–Warshall’s

modules.title: Fundamentals of Economics
topics: Introduction to engineering economics
Demand and supply analysis, elasticity and equilibrium
Consumer behavior and utility analysis

modules.title: Production and Cost Analysis
topics: Production function and laws of production
Cost concepts: fixed, variable and total cost
Economies of scale and long-run cost analysis

modules.title: Market Structures
topics: Perfect competition, monopoly and monopolistic competition
Price-output determination under different markets
Oligopoly models and their implications

modules.title: Macroeconomic Concepts
topics: National income concepts and measurement
Inflation, deflation and business cycles
Fiscal policy and monetary policy

modules.title: Number Systems and Logic Gates
topics: Number systems: binary, octal, hexadecimal and conversions
Boolean algebra and simplification of expressions
Logic gates: AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, XNOR

modules.title: Combinational Circuits
topics: Karnaugh map simplification
Design of adders, subtractors, multiplexers, demultiplexers, encoders, decoders

modules.title: Sequential Circuits
topics: Flip-flops: SR, JK, D and T flip-flops
Registers and counters: synchronous and asynchronous types

modules.title: Memory and Logic Families
topics: Introduction to memory devices (RAM, ROM, EPROM, EEPROM)
Programmable logic devices (PLA, PAL, FPGA)
Logic families: TTL, CMOS

modules.title: Understanding Human Values
topics: Harmony in the human being, family and society
Universal human values and ethical living

modules.title: Ethics in Professional Life
topics: Ethical theories and decision-making models
Professional responsibilities and code of conduct

modules.title: Engineering Ethics and Society
topics: Case studies in engineering ethics
Corporate social responsibility (CSR)

modules.title: Global and Environmental Ethics
topics: Sustainability, environmental protection, and global justice

modules.title: Introduction and Structures
topics: Definition and functions of operating systems
System calls, system programs and kernel structure

modules.title: Process Management
topics: Process states, scheduling algorithms
Inter-process communication and synchronization
Deadlock detection, prevention and recovery

modules.title: Memory Management
topics: Contiguous and non-contiguous allocation
Paging, segmentation and virtual memory concepts

modules.title: File and I/O Management
topics: File system organization and access methods
Disk scheduling algorithms, protection and security mechanisms

modules.title: Basic Computer Organization
topics: Structure and function of computer system components
Instruction cycle, addressing modes and instruction formats

modules.title: Control Unit and Data Path
topics: Hardwired and microprogrammed control unit design
Arithmetic logic unit (ALU) and data path operations

modules.title: Memory Hierarchy
topics: Cache memory mapping techniques and replacement policies
Main and secondary memory organization

modules.title: Input/Output Organization
topics: I/O interfaces, interrupt handling and direct memory access (DMA)

modules.title: Foundations of Algorithm Analysis
topics: Growth of functions, recurrence relations
Asymptotic notation and complexity classes

modules.title: Divide and Conquer
topics: Merge sort, quick sort, binary search, Strassen’s matrix multiplication

modules.title: Greedy Algorithms
topics: Minimum spanning tree algorithms (Kruskal’s and Prim’s)
Single-source shortest path (Dijkstra’s)

modules.title: Dynamic Programming
topics: Matrix chain multiplication, knapsack problem, longest common subsequence

modules.title: Graph Algorithms and NP-Completeness
topics: Graph traversal, topological sorting, NP-hard and NP-complete problems

modules.title: Introduction to Innovation
topics: Concept and process of innovation
Creativity, ideation and design thinking

modules.title: Entrepreneurship Fundamentals
topics: Definition and characteristics of entrepreneurs
Types of entrepreneurship: social, technological, corporate

modules.title: Business Model and Planning
topics: Business model canvas, value proposition and customer segments
Market analysis and feasibility studies

modules.title: Funding and Enterprise Management
topics: Sources of finance, venture capital, and startup funding mechanisms
Government policies and institutional support for entrepreneurship

modules.title: Nature and Scope of Managerial Economics
topics: Micro and macroeconomics in business decision-making
Opportunity cost, incremental and marginal analysis

modules.title: Demand and Supply
topics: Demand function and forecasting methods
Elasticity of demand and supply

modules.title: Production and Cost Analysis
topics: Production functions, returns to scale
Short-run and long-run cost analysis

modules.title: Pricing and Market Structure
topics: Pricing under perfect competition, monopoly and oligopoly
Break-even analysis and profit planning

modules.title: Ecosystem and Natural Resources
topics: Structure and function of ecosystems
Natural resources: forest, water, mineral, food and energy

modules.title: Environmental Pollution
topics: Types of pollution: air, water, soil and noise
Control measures and environmental protection acts

modules.title: Social Issues and Sustainable Development
topics: Global warming, climate change and waste management
Sustainable development goals (SDGs)
